thread.title_full: The Ghazi Attack vs Running Shaadi box-office collection: The war film trumps the rom-com on Friday : Bollywood, News - India Today

title: The Ghazi Attack vs Running Shaadi box-office collection: The war film trumps the rom-com on Friday : Bollywood, News - India Today
text:
Bollywood The Ghazi Attack vs Running Shaadi box-office collection: The war film trumps the rom-com on Friday While The Ghazi Attack starring Rana Daggubati, Kay Kay Menon and Atul Kulkarni opened decently on Friday, the romantic caper Running Shaadi struggled to do well on its first day of release. IndiaToday.in | Written by Devarsi Ghosh A + A - 
Friday, February 17 was jam-packed with multiple Bollywood and Hollywood releases. 
On the Bollywood front, there was the war film The Ghazi Attack, the romantic caper Running Shaadi and the eco-thriller Irada. Competing with these was Akshay Kumar -starrer Jolly LLB 2 which released the week before. 
Adding to the woes were the Hollywood releases; Silence, John Wick 2, The Lego Batman Movie and Hidden Figures. 
While Irada's box-office returns were negligible, The Ghazi Attack and Running Shaadi managed to reach a respectable first-day total at the box-office on Friday, considering that both films are devoid of big stars. 
MOVIE REVIEW: RUNNING SHAADI 
While The Ghazi Attack starring Rana Daggubati, Kay Kay Menon, Atul Kulkarni and Taapsee Pannu grossed Rs 4.25 crore from all over India, Running Shaadi managed to earn a modest Rs 1 crore at the box office. The Hindi version of The Ghazi Attack earned Rs 1.65 crore. 
The Ghazi Attack has received favourable reviews from critics and considering its themes of war and patriotism plus the additional advantage of being uniquely set inside a submarine, the film is expected to earn big on Saturday and Sunday. 
However, the Amit Sadh and Taapsee Pannu-starrer Running Shaadi has to really pull up its socks in the weekend if it hopes to become a profitable venture for its producers.
